Returns: The options to be used for shadow, overlay and rounded corner.
createShadowOverlayOptions().Description: Create ShadowOverlayHelper Options. Subclass may override. e.g. return new ShadowOverlayHelper.Options().roundedCornerRadius(10);

isUsingDefaultSelectEffect().Description: ListRowPresenter overrides the default select effect of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#RowPresenter_E@ and return false.

areChildRoundedCornersEnabled().Description: Returns true if rounded corners are enabled for children of this row.

getRowHeight().Description: Returns the row height for list rows created by this Presenter.

Parameters: int: The row height in to use when the row is expanded, in pixels, or WRAP_CONTENT, or 0 to use the default.
setExpandedRowHeight(int).Description: Sets the expanded row height for rows created by this Presenter. If not set, expanded rows have the same height as unexpanded rows.

isUsingZOrder(android.content.Context).Description: Returns true if SDK >= L, where Z shadow is enabled so that Z order is enabled on each child of horizontal list. If subclass returns false in isUsingDefaultShadow() and does not use Z-shadow on SDK >= L, it should override isUsingZOrder() return false.

setNumRows(int).Description: Sets the numbers of rows for rendering the list of items. By default, it is set to 1.

enableChildRoundedCorners(boolean).Description: Enables or disabled rounded corners on children of this row. Supported on Android SDK >= L.

Parameters: boolean: true if keep foreground of child of this row, false ListRowPresenter might change the foreground of the child.
setKeepChildForeground(boolean).Description: When ListRowPresenter applies overlay color on the child, it may change child's foreground Drawable. If application uses child's foreground for other purposes such as ripple effect, it needs tell ListRowPresenter to keep the child's foreground. The default value is true.

getFocusZoomFactor().Description: Returns the zoom factor used for focus highlighting.

Parameters: int: Controls the zoom factor used when an item view is focused. One of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_NONE_E@, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_SMALL_E@, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_XSMALL_E@, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_MEDIUM_E@, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_LARGE_E@
boolean: determines if the FocusHighlighter will use the dimmer
ListRowPresenter(int, boolean).Description: Constructs a ListRowPresenter with the given parameters.

getZoomFactor().Description: use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRowPresenter#getFocusZoomFactor_E@ instead. Returns the zoom factor used for focus highlighting.

isUsingZOrder().Description: Returns true if SDK >= L, where Z shadow is enabled so that Z order is enabled on each child of horizontal list. If subclass returns false in isUsingDefaultShadow() and does not use Z-shadow on SDK >= L, it should override isUsingZOrder() return false.

Parameters: int: Row height in pixels, or WRAP_CONTENT, or 0 to use the default height.
setRowHeight(int).Description: Sets the row height for rows created by this Presenter. Rows created before calling this method will not be updated.

getShadowEnabled().Description: Returns true if child shadow is enabled. This is not only for enable/disable default shadow implementation but also subclass must respect this flag.

isUsingDefaultListSelectEffect().Description: Returns true so that default select effect is applied to each individual child of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#HorizontalGridView_E@. Subclass may return false to disable the default implementation and implement @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRowPresenter#applySelectLevelToChild_E@.

Returns: true if keeps foreground of child of this row, false otherwise.
isKeepChildForeground().Description: Returns true if keeps foreground of child of this row, false otherwise. When ListRowPresenter applies overlay color on the child, it may change child's foreground Drawable. If application uses child's foreground for other purposes such as ripple effect, it needs tell ListRowPresenter to keep the child's foreground. The default value is true.

isUsingDefaultShadow().Description: Default implementation returns true if SDK version >= 21, shadow (either static or z-order based) will be applied to each individual child of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#HorizontalGridView_E@. Subclass may return false to disable default implementation of shadow and provide its own.

ListRowPresenter().Description: Constructs a ListRowPresenter with defaults. Uses @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_MEDIUM_E@ for focus zooming and disabled dimming on focus.

Returns: A ViewHolder for the Row's View.
Parameters: ViewGroup: The parent View for the Row's view holder.
createRowViewHolder(android.view.ViewGro.Description: Called to create a ViewHolder object for a Row. Subclasses will override this method to return a different concrete ViewHolder object.

canDrawOutOfBounds().Description: Returns true if the Row view can draw outside its bounds.

getHoverCardPresenterSelector().Description: Returns the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PresenterSelector_E@ used for showing a select object in a hover card.

getExpandedRowHeight().Description: Returns the expanded row height for rows created by this Presenter.

isFocusDimmerUsed().Description: Returns true if the focus dimmer is used for focus highlighting; false otherwise.

setShadowEnabled(boolean).Description: Enables or disables child shadow. This is not only for enable/disable default shadow implementation but also subclass must respect this flag.

Parameters: int: Controls the zoom factor used when an item view is focused. One of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_NONE_E@, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_SMALL_E@, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_XSMALL_E@, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_MEDIUM_E@, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FocusHighlight#ZOOM_FACTOR_LARGE_E@ Dimming on focus defaults to disabled.
ListRowPresenter(int).Description: Constructs a ListRowPresenter with the given parameters.

ClassDesc: ListRowPresenter renders @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRow_E@ using a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#HorizontalGridView_E@ hosted in a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRowView_E@. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRowPresenter#setHoverCardPresenterSelector_E@ can be used to display a view for the currently focused list item below the rendered list. This view is known as a hover card. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#RowPresenter_E@'s default full row dimming effect and draws a dim overlay on each child individually. A subclass may disable the overlay on each child by overriding @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRowPresenter#isUsingDefaultListSelectEffect_E@ to return false and write its own child dim effect in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRowPresenter#applySelectLevelToChild_E@. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRowPresenter#setShadowEnabled_E@ to disable shadows. A subclass may override and return false in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ListRowPresenter#isUsingDefaultShadow_E@ and replace with its own shadow implementation.
